comment: Attendance is mandatory, but you can miss a few times. Grades are from 9 assignments (completion grade) and 2 exams, midterm, and final. The exams are open exactly like the homework. Her lectures are confusing, but the material is not hard to understand.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I highly recommend her! Her course was straightforward to follow. Although her lectures are textbook-heavy and long, you can watch YouTube videos to help out with homework. Staying on top of submissions and 2 tests, midterm and final, will get you a promising grade.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor WeiWei is super nice. Her lectures are long and very descriptive. Lots of quizzes but they are super easy and open note. Two tests that are also super easy and open note. Lots of extra credit opportunities. There is a group project but if you have good team members you will be good. Extra credit points for attendance.

She was an okay professor, mainly just lectures and quizzes. The material was pretty easy, and attendance is for extra credit. We had a semester-long project which she was kinda unclear about, but the class is manageable.

Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended. Very difficult subject and the professor was very knowledgeable however I don't think it was taught effectively. I found myself needing to utilize alternative sites to understand the material.  a lot was new to me and the basics weren't communicated very well. Very caring and kind teacher.

As she readily admits, she's very soft-spoken. Not a great combo when there are long lectures almost every class. Extra credit opportunities on all HW (which is in Excel and is difficult), difficult tests, overall hard class but a decent professor. Powerpoints are online-accessible, Coles-provided, & modeled on the textbook.

Only 2 tests, midterm and final. Homework takes a pretty long time to do and is due every week or every other week, depending on the chapter. There is an opportunity for extra credit by doing corrections on each homework assignment. She also only grades the assignments by completion so that helps. Lectures are boring and attendance isn't necessary.

Class is 9 homework assignments (completion as long as you show work) and 2 exams. First exam is in person and it's open note. 2nd one is online and also open note. As long as you go to class you can learn and remember the material. She is also very helpful when you don't understand something. Overall a very caring professor.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Chen is very intelligent. Economics of Healthcare is a tough class in general and she does a great job covering a lot of dense material. She allowed for open notes and does not take attendance. I would take her again. She genuinely cares about her students and is always willing to answer questions to ensure people understand the material.

This class was by far the toughest ECON class I have taken thus far. Professor Chen does a decent job with the lectures and does give ample opportunity for questions. However, I found most students didn't ask any questions because they were unsure about the material. She does give 1 extra credit and I suggest you do it early in the semester!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: This class is honestly one of the worst classes I have ever taken. Professor Wei Wei reads off slides and I mean strictly slides. You have a better chance getting the information off of Youtube. If you want to be miserable take this class. Also, her grading scale is awful she can basically give you whatever grade she wants without feedback.

I was very nervous on what to expect when signing up for her class, but she honestly wasn't as bad as I thought. She made business statistics, one of the hardest classes I have taken manageable with open note tests and would answer anyone's questions during the lectures. She made it easier to understand, but sometimes has a hard time explaining.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: She is caring and very flexible with resources used for tests and homework. Lectures can overcomplicate some material, and sometimes she doesn't have the answers people are looking for. Overall, she's pretty great, though.

WeiWei is a nice lady and cares for you, but the class is extremely hard to get through. It is super hard to understand what she is saying and impossible to comprehend the material. She just reads off power points and gives no explanation. Luckily, the class was pretty easy because all assignments/tests were open notes.

Professor Chen was great! She's the reason why I passed Business statistics. She cares for you, she does have a heavier accent but it's still pretty easy to comprehend her. Her tests and quizzes are all open note. Her homework is all based on participation, very easy class with her. TAKE HER IF YOU WANT AN EASY A

I had a great experienced but I can see how Prof. Chen might not be for everyone. The tradeoff was less/easier work for slightly harder to understand lectures and not every question will be answered. But she cares about you and the tests/weekly assignments are open book/open notes and no lockdown. I would take her again.

Her lectures are very boring but the work is easy. She doesn’t take attendance, she does call on people in class to answer questions to make you engage. A teams link is available if you can’t make it in person. Quizzes on each chapter, 2 exams and 5 team debates throughout the semester. Overall, the class is easy, just very boring.
Study lecture slide you will be fine. She has an issue explaining word problems. I would take her again.

The worst professor I have had in college. She was my only professor to make in-person attendance mandatory during the pandemic and would mark students absent even if they attended virtually. She just reads off the powerpoints and does not explain. Grades are made up of 3 tests. After the first test, the class average was 55 and many had to drop.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Tough grader
